results.title: The Clerk
results.creator_credit: Allan Wargon, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
This film explores the conflict between what a man (in this case an office clerk) wants from his job and what the company wants from him. It raises the question of how far an industry ought to be expected to go in relieving dull, repetitive work for the sake of employee satisfaction.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Allan Wargon, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Vice President
results.creator_credit: Hugh O'Connor, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
Elevation to the position of Vice-President brings prestige responsibility and freedoms of action, but it also means a shifting of loyalties and the losing of personal contact. This is shown in the dramatised story of John Harvard who rising from Branch Director to Vice-President finds himself having to put pressure on the men who a short time ago were his near equals. Only by going against their wishes can he serve the best interests of his company.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh O’Connor, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Skilled worker
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
This film examines the inroads of automation on whole areas of satisfaction and reward in work, as exemplified in the story of a craftsman who finds his carefully acquired manual skills displaced by a machine. (Award: Stockholm)

results.title: The Man on the assembly line
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
A dramatized look at a man who ultimately pays the price for the benefits associated with modern mass production - a worker in an automobile factory who performs one operation with relentless monotony so that the assembly line can keep moving at top efficiency.

results.title: The General foreman
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
The general foreman is an example of “the man in the middle”, subject to pressures from above and below. The film dramatizes his con.licting loyalties to the company and the men under him

results.title: The Department manager
results.creator_credit: Hugh O'Connor, Nicholas Balla, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
This film is centered on a mini-drama in which a successful design engineer encounters many problems when he is promoted to a managerial position. The film raises questions about the sources of job satisfaction, the perils of promotion from within the organization, and the demands that are put on a person placed for the first time in an administrative or managerial role.

results.title: La Trobe Cottage
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, National Trust and Ampol Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “National Trust”.
A look at La Trobe Cottage, Victoria’s first Government House. Brought out from England, it was assembled on a foundation of hand-made bricks.

results.title: Como
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “National Trust”.
Looks at the National Trust property, Como, giving a description of the buildings and a brief history. Built prior to 1851, it was the home of the Armitage family until acquisition by the National Trust. Script by Glenn Berry.
